page.title: 17LEISURE IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: Leisure activities in the villages of{ {East Stoke}and{Elston}are fairly limited. Apart from the games of dominoes, skittles, darts and checkers played in the local public houses, the leisure activities centre mainly on women's organisations. There is a{ {Women's Institute}in each village. The W.I. hut has recently been refurbished with the help of a grant from the Local Authority and is used for village events such as whist drives.{ {Elston}has a{Mothers' Union}, a{Mother {and Toddlers Group}, and a women's section of the{British Legion.}There are occasional handicraft and dress-making courses. The "Senior Citizens" are catered for by the{ {Over-60's club.} At present the vicar is attempting to organise a{Youth {Club. }
